name: NSObject
desc: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.

items.name: - class
items.desc: Returns the class object for the receiver’s class.

items.name: - isEqual:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver and a given object are equal.

items.name: - isKindOfClass:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of given class or an instance of any class that inherits from that class.

items.name: - isMemberOfClass:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of a given class.

items.name: - respondsToSelector:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver implements or inherits a method that can respond to a specified message.

items.name: - conformsToProtocol:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver conforms to a given protocol.

items.name: - performSelector:
items.desc: Sends a specified message to the receiver and returns the result of the message.

items.name: - performSelector:withObject:
items.desc: Sends a message to the receiver with an object as the argument.

items.name: - performSelector:withObject:withObject:
items.desc: Sends a message to the receiver with two objects as arguments.

items.name: - isProxy
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver does not descend from NSObject.

items.name: - autorelease
items.desc: Decrements the receiver’s retain count at the end of the current autorelease pool block.

items.name: - zone
items.desc: Zones are deprecated and ignored by most classes that have it as a parameter.
